titleStmt.title: Constant, faire, and fine Betty Being the young-mans praise, of a curious creature. Faire shee was, and faire indeed, and constant alwayes did proceed. To the tune of, Peggy went over sea, with a souldier.
titleStmt.author: Crimsal, Richard.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Iohn Wright the yonger dwelling at the upper end of the Old-Baily,

notesStmt.note: Signed at the end: R.C., i.e. Richard Crimsal.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Identified as STC 4517 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1475-1640".
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the upper end of the Old-Baily
